doc.previous: In terms of land area, Miami is one of the smallest major cities in the United States. According to the US Census Bureau, the city encompasses a total area of 55.27Â sqÂ mi (143.1Â km2). Of that area, 35.67Â sqÂ mi (92.4Â km2) is land and 19.59Â sqÂ mi (50.7Â km2) is water. That means Miami comprises over 400,000 people in 35 square miles (91Â km2), making it one of the most densely populated cities in the United States, along with New York City, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, and Philadelphia.
